student

Class EscapeInformedGoldSeekExitOpt

  • java.lang.Object
    • student.EscapeInformedGoldSeekExitOpt
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EscapeStrategy

    public class EscapeInformedGoldSeekExitOpt
extends java.lang.Object
implements EscapeStrategy
    Author:
    ypalac01 An implementation of the EscapeStratety interface. It is characterize as being: - Informed: Since it defines and uses four data structures (Maps) to gather as much information as possible about all the nodes in the cavern and leverage this information in the navigation process. - Gold-seek oriented: Since it searches for as much gold as possible until it knows that it needs to head to the Exit node to avoid being trapped in the cavern. - Exit-Optimizer: In the sense that once it knows that it needs to head to the Exit node, it uses the minimal path strategy to reach that Exit node.

    • Method Detail

      • getDistanceToNode

        public int getDistanceToNode(game.Node inputNode)
        Returns the distance between the state's current node and a particular node. If the node is a neighbor it returns the length of the edge between them.
        Parameters:
        inputNode. - A node whose distance we want to estimate from the state's current node.
        Returns:
        int. The distance between the state's current node and the node specified as a parameter. If the parameter node is a neighbor, it returns the length of the edge between them. If the parameter node is not a neighbor, it returns an infinitive value (Integer.MAX_VALUE).

      • getNeighbors

        public java.util.Collection<game.Node> getNeighbors(game.Node node)
        Provides all the navigable neighbors of node. Navigable means any node that is open. This method significantly improves the performance of the EscapeStrategy.
        Parameters:
        node. - Any node whose neighbor's are to be determined.
        Returns:
        a collection of nodes. A collection of nodes that represents all the neighbor's of the node specified as a parameter.

      • getClusterGold

        public java.lang.Integer getClusterGold(game.Node node)
        Provides the current gold level of a node and its neighbors' gold level.
        Parameters:
        node. - Any node whose gold and neighbor's current gold level is to be calculated.
        Returns:
        Integer. The sum of the current gold level of a node and its neighbors'.

      • populateMaps

        public void populateMaps()
        Populates all the different data structures being used in the class.

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Implementation of method from EscapeStrategy interface. Description of procedures: a - Ensures that there is enough time to reach the exit node before moving to any new node. b - Filters for reachable, unvisited neighbor nodes, with either gold itself or its neighbors. Selects the one that has the highest cluster gold level (its gold level and the neighbor's gold level). c - If there isn't a node from b, then filters for a reachable neighbor, selects the less visited one of them. d - If there isn't a node from c, then retrieves the metadata of the current node to find optimal path to exit and executes path.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface EscapeStrategy
